steps.description: Start in a standing position, barbell on your shoulders/upper back, feet slightly wider than your hips.
Move your hips backwards while bending your knees. Maintain a straight back all time.
Bend down until your hips are lower than your knees (Or as low as you can go without losing form).
Hold the bar at hip level with your knees slightly bent.
Lower the bar by moving your hips back. Move the bar down your body while moving forward. Stop just below your knees.
Return to the starting position by moving your hips forward.
Hands more than shoulder wide apart, pointing forward.
Pull yourself up until the chin clears the bar.
Jump 180 degrees to your right while keeping your hands in front of you for balance. As soon as you land jump 180 degrees to your left
Start in a standing position
Take off using both feet. Swing you arms and bend your knees to provide a forward drive. As soon as you land, jump again.
Start in a kneeling position. Arms behind your body.
Explode up into a standing position with your knees bent. Your arms move in front of your body.
As soon as your feet touch the floor, jump again while moving your knees up. Try to touch your hands with your knees.

Take a large step forward and lower your body toward the floor. Both legs should be bent at 90-degree angle. Lower your back knee slightly and explode up to switch legs. Land in the bent position and repeat.
Begin in a planking position. Back straight and hands directly under your shoulders
Lower like you would do a push-up till your chest nearly touches the floor. Maintain this position for the required time
Hold as long as you can. Switch legs and repeat. (Left and right leg = 1 set)
Hold as long as you can.
Start with traditional skipping and gradually increase knee and rebound height with every step.
Sprint for 5 seconds. Rest for 10 seconds and repeat
